body:

#### Truehope Campus - A Canadian nonprofit
1. http://www.Truehope.com/ - "Advanced Natural Medicine"  
"Nutrient Theory of Mental Illness, Clinical Research,  
Information For Healthcare Professionals,  
Video and Written Testimonials."
2. http://www.Truehope.com/winning-court-case.html - 2006  
Health Canada v. Truehope Court Case - "... stop selling and distributing ..." - 2003  
"Fearing for the health, safety and well-being ... continued to take orders ...  
transmit the orders ..., and distribute ... in Canada." - 2003  
http://www.Truehope.com/uploads/4/4/5/6/44562925/full_written_decision.pdf  
Full written decision - Honorable Judge G. M. Meagher, 2006  
  1. p.14-15, "[59] ... the Defendants were under a duty or duties described in  
... the Criminal Code of Canada to continue to provide the vitamin/mineral  
micronutrient treatment and to maintain the support program or  
possibly face the consequences of being charged with criminal negligence. ...  
Further, the Defendants argued that it was established law  
that it was no defence to charges of criminal negligence  
to say that one had to cause harm  
because one had to comply with licensing requirement."
  2. p.11, "[43] ... As stated by the Supreme Court of Canada ...:  
'... a liberal and humane criminal law cannot  
hold people to the strict obedience of laws  
in emergency situations where normal human instincts, ...,  
overwhelmingly compel disobedience.'"
  3. Q: Was Health Canada (Canada's "FDA") themselves  
perhaps guilty of committing Criminal Negligence in 2003?
  4. Q: Are Health care facilities and practitioners in either  
Canada or the USA perhaps guilty of committing Criminal Negligence Today  
if they refuse to competently and knowledgably begin practicing  
(micro)Nutritional Psychiatry immediately Without Waiting for  
(micro)Nutritional Psychiatry to have a Strong legal basis?
  5. Q: Do the laws pertaining to Criminal Negligence have a
    - Strong legal basis in Canada, but a
    - Weak legal basis in the USA?
  6. Q: Did the Canadian laws pertaining to Criminal Negligence in 2003  
have a Strong Enough legal basis to Prevent, in the First Place,  
Health Canada themselves from perhaps committing Criminal Negligence in 2003?
  7. Q: Do the laws pertaining to Criminal Negligence Today in either  
Canada or the USA have a Strong Enough legal basis to Prevent, in the First Place,  
Health care facilities and practitioners from perhaps committing  
Criminal Negligence Today by refusing to competently and knowledgably  
begin practicing (micro)Nutritional Psychiatry immediately Without Waiting  
for (micro)Nutritional Psychiatry to have a Strong Enough legal basis?
  8. This author, with the above, has made obvious the, "Emperors' New Clothes":  
“Remember, it's better to build a fence at the top of the cliff  
than a hospital at the bottom.”  
.  
By building a Strong Enough fence (Strong Enough Criminal Negligence legal basis),  
you Prevent the committing of Criminal Negligence in the First Place, Ever Again!  
.  
The Weak legal basis of Criminal Negligence and Professional Competencies in Psychiatry  
(including, but not limited to, "Scientific Orientation" and "Systems Thinking")  
are the "Broken Fences" ("New Clothes"). [ASPPB Competencies Expected of Psychologists]
(http://www.asppb.net/resource/resmgr/Guidelines/ASPPB_Competencies_Expected_.pdf)  
.  
Our problematic and dysfunctional Medical and Legal Systems ("Emperors")  
are the "Hospitals" at the bottom of the cliff.
    9. Whistleblower training (["force multiplication"]
(https://duckduckgo.com/?q=%22force+multiplication%22&t=ftas&ia=about)):
      - ["Tribes: We Need You to Lead Us", Seth Godin]
(https://duckduckgo.com/?q=%22Tribes%3A+We+Need+You+to+Lead+Us%22%2C+Seth+Godin&t=ftas&ia=products)  
      - ["The Tipping Point", Malcolm Gladwell]
(https://duckduckgo.com/?q=%22The+Tipping+Point%22%2C+Malcolm+Gladwell&t=ftas&ia=products)

#### Oxyfresh Campus
1. http://Greatnessguru.LifeShotz.com/ - New program name: Life Matters  
"We didn't need to find a miracle berry in a rainforest.  
We just turned to research ...."
2. http://Oxyfresh.com/Greatnessguru/ - Parent company of Life Matters  
"Discover premium ... dental, pet,  
weight loss, and personal/home products  
... people around the world ... use, love and buy forever."
